alert.note: Alert for Bennington; Eastern Windham; Western Windham (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 29 at 1:34PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...Dangerous Travel Conditions Due to Snow Squalls and Flash Freeze This Evening... A period of initial rain changing to snow or sleet with embedded snow squalls and even rumbles of thunder is expected late this afternoon into this evening as a strong cold front races from northwest to southeast through the region. Strong west to northwest wind gusts up to 40 to 50mph are expected which when combined with falling snow will likely result in rapid reductions to visibility and dangerous travel conditions, especially on high speed highways, due to quickly falling temperatures. A flash freeze is also possible which would lead to icy roads. Precautionary/Preparedness Actions... Be prepared for brief whiteout conditions. This could lead to dangerous driving conditions, especially on high speed highways. Icy conditions are also possible on any untreated roads. If you are traveling and encounter adverse winter driving conditions, reduce speed and make sure headlights are on.
